item.title: Pothole in centre of road, 18th April
item.description:
Several potholes in middle of road along the length of Dark Lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 54 Dark Lane, Cheltenham

item.title: Deep pothole widening in a second which will soon become a crater, 18th April
item.description:
Pothole reopened following the last council bodged repair in January. Incredibly the crater next to it has recently been marked for repair but the one just a meter away totally ignored It clearly exceeds the threshold for urgent repair and is baffling why it wouldn't be fixed at the sane time as the council repair team are standing just a meter away with all the repair supplies. The whole section needs properly cutting out and resurfacing - not another badly executed dog turd fix by Bodgeit, Bashit and Scarper; the councils executive repair team

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 22 Whittington Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: "Incident" Cyclist doored by car driver, 18th April
item.description:
Reported to the police today 18/4. One way road (for cars only!) Cars parked either side Only enough room for a vehicle to pass (narrow) Car coming the opposite direction made the cyclist pull to the side due to approaching speed. Car parked nearby opened door on cyclist. Car was also parked the wrong way, indicating the driver wasn't fit to drive. Awful idea/design. This places vulnerable road users at risk. This needs redesigning before someone is seriously injured or killed! This is not unique to this road either!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 49 Winchcombe Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severn Trent Manhole cover on London Road, 18th April
item.description:
Manhole cover fixed once a year, never properly. Amount of traffic driving over it means it soon starts to fail & tarmac breaks up. Extremely noisy - have to keep windows shut at night as noise keeps me awake. Problem started again in February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 239a London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faulty manhole cover, 18th April
item.description:
Manhole cover is failing yet again. The tarmac is already started eroding. The noise is unbearable when vehicles drive over them. This has been going on for years and 'mended' several times. Can someone from Severn Trent give me a call to discuss please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Sandhurst Place London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 7 inch pothole about 3ft long by 2ft wide, 17th April
item.description:
Massive pothole that needs fixing as may cause an accident or car damage quite easily
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge dumped, 17th April
item.description:
Someone has dumped a small fridge in the layby :(

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cotswold Valley View Leckhampton Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: A series of potholes on the junction of Hewlett Road ans Ariel Lodge Road, 17th April
item.description:
These potholes have been developing over several months and appear to be related to an old trench across the main road, the edges of which have begun to crumble under the continual passing of HGVs. Every vehicle passing over this trench causes my house to tremble - the heavier the vehicle, the more the house shakes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 149 Hewlett Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in water way, 17th April

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 The Firs, Cheltenham

item.title: Packing on corners, 17th April
item.description:
This is happening more and more, those cars have no regard for other people that live in the street. This makes it very difficult for myself and neighbours to get off our driveway due to the way they are parking.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 Boleyn Close, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
